pullRequest.body:
This reduces the file from ~2600 lines to ~1600 lines.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

- [x] depends on: #7925

Commits work individually. I have no strong attachment to any of these changes in particular, if there's better ways to organize the code.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Note: I have pushed an update to the lean toolchain because this PR was on a [buggy version](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113488-general/topic/Potential.20data.20loss.20from.20.60lake.20clean.60.20with.204.2E2.2E0-rc2.2F3/near/397875701) of the toolchain. **WARNING**: checking out old commits of this PR using v4.2.0-rc2 or v4.2.0-rc3 can cause `lake clean` to delete your mathlib folder! If you need to do so, make sure to delete `lakefile.olean` manually before running any `lake` commands.

> Thank you for taking this on. It's very helpful to have the changes split into these chunks, thanks!

It might be worth splitting the PR into 3-5 pieces so that those chunks are preserved in the git history after everything is merged.

In particular,

> chore: move Submodule.{map,comap} to Algebra.Module.Submodule.Map

Looks like it would do well as a standalone PR

> In particular,
> 
> > chore: move Submodule.{map,comap} to Algebra.Module.Submodule.Map
> 
> Looks like it would do well as a standalone PR

I'll take a look

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#7925~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Happy to split up further if you give concrete suggestions :)

> I'd like to try running a round of import reduction on the split results, so that `LinearAlgebra.Basic` might be replaced with one of its imports. Do you all think that I should do so as part of this PR or as a follow-up?

FWIW, in #7920 I also put a [commit](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/7920/commits/258873c8f5dff6b9adbc191019027d4f25f81fe4) reducing the imports again, and the reviewer didn't mind. (I'm not a reviewer, though.)
I took the liberty of pushing the results of my minimizer script. We may have to fix some downstream imports.
@eric-wieser I think this is ready to merge but I pushed some changes. Could you do a final review?

Merged master to see if that results in any CI issues.

This looks good to me, but I believe there is still an unanswered remark about moving `pi_apply_eq_sum_univ`

bors d+

:v: Ruben-VandeVelde can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

bors r+

Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6880460493/job/18714722993)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6880460493/job/18714723571)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6880460493/job/18714723844)

Thank you for taking this on. It's very helpful to have the changes split into these chunks, thanks!

Looks like there's a missing import in `Mathlib/Topology/EMetricSpace/Basic.lean`.

I'd like to try running a round of import reduction on the split results, so that `LinearAlgebra.Basic` might be replaced with one of its imports. Do you all think that I should do so as part of this PR or as a follow-up?
Otherwise, I'm happy with this PR. If we want further splitting, let's do that in follow-up PRs. @eric-wieser, what do you think?
This doesn't seem to involve submodules? It can probably go all the way to the basic linear map file. (This seems to hold for all changes in `c809cea5477043491f1363cc7ecfd43e7f7e8ed3`.)

`LinearMap.ringLmapEquivSelf` needed linear equivalences, so I moved it to `Mathlib/Algebra/Module/Equiv.lean`. 

`LinearMap.domRestrict'` does need submodules, so I left it in `Mathlib/Algebra/Module/Submodule/LinearMap.lean`.

Moved everything else.
This doesn't seem to involve submodules either.
This one either.
This one either.
Could you add a list of important declarations in this file? I would nominate `subtype`, `domRestrict`, `restrict` and `ofLe`.

We don't need all these variables, right, so could you only keep the necessary ones? Also for other files.

(It would be nice to have an "unused `variable` declaration" linter that figures this out for us!)
Could you add a brief overview of this file to the documentation? I nominate mentioning: `map`, `comap`, `giMapComap` and `gciMapComap`.
I'm not convinced by this split; for `Submonoid` and `Subgroup`, don't we define this map pretty immediately?

No for `Submonoid` (it's in `Mathlib.GroupTheory.Submonoid.Operations`) but yes for `Subgroup` (in `Mathlib.GroupTheory.Subgroup.Basic`. I felt this file had pretty heavy imports, but I'm also happy to revert this part.
@Vierkantor, I'll let you make the call on this

My impression is that `Submodule.subtype` is not used too commonly, so I don't mind the split. This also means we don't have to import `LinearMap` when defining `Submodule` which is nice for combing the imports.

I suppose we might as well fix the docstring.
```suggestion
This is an `S`-linear equivalence, under the assumption that `S` acts on `M` commuting with `R`.
```
Should this be moved to LinearAlgebra.Pi?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: redistribute some of the results in LinearAlgebra.Basic
